ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000HhqXs:ref

Hello,

Thank you.
Could you please clarify about the CAP browser extension to make a CAP work with browser print?
How to install and use it? If you have a link to instruction from the manual, please send it.
Also, if this feature is Windows only, is it possible to block print from browser for Linux and MacOS?


Best regards,

[cid:926f67a1-1cbf-48d3-bcd2-0550437ef290@Image_1_]



Danylo Didenko

Security Support Engineer

CoreWin<https://corewin.ua/en/> | Contacts<https://corewin.ua/contacts/>




________________________________
From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 31, 2024 12:31
To: Danylo Didenko <danylo.d@corewin.ua>
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #425626 - - How to block printing documents from Browser [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HhqXs:ref ]

Hello Danylo,

Thank you for getting back to us.

As specified in our User Manual:

  *   Block Print from Browsers – Enable this setting to prevent users from printing web pages from any supported browser on Windows.

NOTE: The Content-Aware Protection (CAP) feature is available only for Chrome and Edge via a dedicated extension. For other browsers, this setting will block print functionality.

  *   Block Print if CAP Cannot Process File – This setting determines the action if CAP cannot access the file content. By default, printing is allowed. This option applies only to Chrome and Edge with the browser extension on Windows.

Regarding the network printers, could you please provide us a set of logs from the affected machine?

Looking forward for your response

Best regards,
__________________
Daniel Anton | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | MDM | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
www.netwrix.com

[https://www.endpointprotector.com/images/img/email_resources/email_signature_epp_logo_small.png]

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #425626 - ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000HhqXs:ref - How to block printing documents from Browser [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HhqXs:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000HhqXs:ref

Hello,

Thank you for your recommendation, we proposed customer to enable these settings.
Will it just block all the print from browser or just confidential files?
Also, if this feature is Windows only, is it possible to block print from browser for Linux and MacOS?

Meanwhile, customer shared a kind of bug in the report section, attaching a screenshot.
If they try to print a file with Network printer and CAP Remediation policy type, in CAP report the Destination Type first shows like "Network Printer" and after Remediation was canceled the Destination Type is "Local Printers" for some reason.


Best regards,

[cid:623fcfc1-0250-4c04-8157-02c44f100b3d@Image_2_]



Danylo Didenko

Security Support Engineer

CoreWin<https://corewin.ua/en/> | Contacts<https://corewin.ua/contacts/>

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 31, 2024 11:55
To: Danylo Didenko <danylo.d@corewin.ua>
Subject: How to block printing documents from Browser [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HhqXs:ref ]


Hello Danylo,

Thank you for reaching out!

In the Device Control menu, under the Global Settings, you will have an option that will need to be enabled block print from browsers.
[Screenshot 2024-10-31 at 11.51.06?AM]

Also, please enable the Advanced printers option and then save.

Please restart the endpoint where you want to test, then let us know if the printing from browser is working.

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,
__________________

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 31, 2024 12:31
To: Danylo Didenko <danylo.d@corewin.ua>
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #425626 - - How to block printing documents from Browser [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HhqXs:ref ]

 


Hello Danylo,

Thank you for getting back to us.

As specified in our User Manual: 

	
	Block Print from Browsers – Enable this setting to prevent users from printing web pages from any supported browser on Windows.

	NOTE: The Content-Aware Protection (CAP) feature is available only for Chrome and Edge via a dedicated extension. For other browsers, this setting will block print functionality.
	
	
	Block Print if CAP Cannot Process File – This setting determines the action if CAP cannot access the file content. By default, printing is allowed. This option applies only to Chrome and Edge with the browser extension on Windows.
	

Regarding the network printers, could you please provide us a set of logs from the affected machine? 

Looking forward for your response

Best regards,
__________________
Daniel Anton | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | MDM | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
www.netwrix.com

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000HhqXs:ref
 


Hello,

Thank you for your recommendation, we proposed customer to enable these settings.

Will it just block all the print from browser or just confidential files?

Also, if this feature is Windows only, is it possible to block print from browser for Linux and MacOS?

 

Meanwhile, customer shared a kind of bug in the report section, attaching a screenshot.

If they try to print a file with Network printer and CAP Remediation policy type, in CAP report the Destination Type first shows like "Network Printer" and after Remediation was canceled the Destination Type is "Local Printers" for some reason.


 


	
		
			
			Best regards, 

			 
			
			
			 

			Danylo Didenko 

			Security Support Engineer 

			CoreWin | Contacts

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 31, 2024 12:31
To: Danylo Didenko <danylo.d@corewin.ua>
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #425626 - - How to block printing documents from Browser [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HhqXs:ref ]

 


Hello Danylo,

Thank you for getting back to us.

As specified in our User Manual: 

	
	Block Print from Browsers – Enable this setting to prevent users from printing web pages from any supported browser on Windows.

	NOTE: The Content-Aware Protection (CAP) feature is available only for Chrome and Edge via a dedicated extension. For other browsers, this setting will block print functionality.
	
	
	Block Print if CAP Cannot Process File – This setting determines the action if CAP cannot access the file content. By default, printing is allowed. This option applies only to Chrome and Edge with the browser extension on Windows.
	

Regarding the network printers, could you please provide us a set of logs from the affected machine? 

Looking forward for your response

Best regards,

Subject: How to block printing documents from Browser [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HhqXs:ref ]

 



Hello Danylo,

Thank you for reaching out!


In the Device Control menu, under the Global Settings, you will have an option that will need to be enabled block print from browsers. 


Also, please enable the Advanced printers option and then save. 

Please restart the endpoint where you want to test, then let us know if the printing from browser is working.

Looking forward for your response.
